title: Find LCD
text: The least common denominator of $$\frac{a}{a+12}$$ and $$\frac{4}{7}$$ is $$7\left(a+12\right)$$.
speech: The least common denominator of  fraction, a over, a plus 12,   and  4 sevenths  is , 7 times, parentheses a plus 12,  .
pacedSpeech: The least common denominator of   fraction, a over, a plus 12,

title: Multiply LCD Both Sides
text: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get $$7a=4\left(a+12\right)$$.
speech: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get  7 a is equal to 4 times, parentheses a plus 12,  .
pacedSpeech: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get   7 a is equal to 4 times,  a plus 12,

title: Isolate a on One side
text: We can further simplify $$7a=4\left(a+12\right)$$ to $$7a=4a+48$$. By subtracting 4a both sides, we get $$3a=48$$. Then we divide by $$3$$ both sides of the equation and get $$a=16$$ as the final answer.
speech: We can further simplify  7 a is equal to 4 times, parentheses a plus 12,   to  7 a is equal to, 4 a plus 48 . By subtracting 4a both sides, we get  3 a is equal to, 48 . Then we divide by  3  both sides of the equation and get  a is equal to 16  as the final answer.
